body.p:
Independence Kenton Co Kentucky
April 16 1863
Gov. Robinson.

To His Excellency. Sir. The undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent that on the day of Feb. 1863 John & Leslie Jones were fined each $30,00 for a breach of the peace by fighting with one Mr Bass Their trials were had at Independence Kenton Co. before L. Shaw presiding Judge of the Kenton County Court, then acting as Justice of the peace. Your petitioners do most earnestly and respectfully request your Excellency to remit said fines believing as they do that theirs are cases requiring the exercise of your clemency
Wherefore your petitioners pray that your Excelency remit said fines } Jury

I am acquainted with the facts in this case and feel perfectly sure if they had been fairly presented to the jury, there would have been a very different finding. I think the fines should be remitted
